text: it's not often that the road to marriage
begins in a job interview but that's the
way it was with me I was a director of
grants at Montgomery College a community
college outside of Washington DC and I
had the opportunity to hire someone for
our staff and Robert was an applicant I
was intrigued then he came for the
interview and I was most impressed at
his soft-spoken area dition a slumber
did my spirits seal I had no human fears
she seemed a thing that could not feel
the touch of earthly years we worked
together for seven years and then she
moved back to New York the immediate
impetus for that was 911 because my
grown children were both here and I
wanted to stand with my injured city in
a small act of patriotism to the city I
love I felt somewhat deserted and
abandoned when she did that our
relationship has evolved to accommodate
that change and has only grown stronger
but we kept in communication almost
daily and I commuted first from
Washington and then from Princeton
Robert comes up to New York every
weekend and we have a wonderful time we
both write for a living we love the
English language so we love to read
together the very houses seem asleep and
all that mighty heart is lying still all
that mighty heart my 70th birthday CA
him seemed like an opportune moment we
had already been talking about it for
years and she said is this the time and
I said I think it is the time
I didn't drop to my knees or anything
but we were very pleased I think that
instead of looking forward to the
weekend we'll look forward to a more
distant horizon she has an open heart
and she's very compassionate he has a
tremendous depth of understanding and
has never let me down
you
